online.search
Class Search_Driver

java.lang.Object
  online.search.CommonDriver
      online.search.Search_Driver
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constants
public class Search_Driver
extends CommonDriver
implements Constants

this is the overall controller for a search. Although the actual structure of the search is a traditional alpha-beta driven evaluation, all the data is maintained in this class and Search_Node classes, instead of the traditional recursive stack based structure. It's less effecient this way, but much easier to control the overall progress of the search when the control thread is independent of the search state. * @author ddyer

save_all_variations

public boolean save_all_variations
turn this on as a debugging aid for small searches. Large searches will run out of memory and/or produce way too much data.

use_nullmove

public boolean use_nullmove
if true, use a forced null move first at every turn change, and promote the best continuation of the result as a refutation of each move. For this to work, the client game has to be able to perform MOVE_NULL which is simply a turnover to the next player, even if not normally allowed. the original MAKE/EVAL/UNMAKE sequence for the nullmove is never done, but the nullmove is promoted to the head of the sorted list. Then in the recursion phase, MAKE / CONTINUE / UNMAKE is done on the nullmove, and the PV from the null becomes the first move in all normal continuations, if it was one of the moves on offer.

return_nullmove

public boolean return_nullmove
if return_nullmove is true, nullmove will be part of the normal result and may be returned at top level. If you actually receive a "nullmove" as the principle variation, it means there's no way to improve your position within the search depth.

rand

public java.util.Random rand
the source of randomness for this search. This is always a new psuedorandom sequence. If you want repeatable searches, you should call with random=0

                     double progresive_time,

                     boolean alpha_beta_cutoff,
                     boolean good_enough_cutoff)
this is the recommended constructor for a search driver.

Parameters:
robo - the robot to assist the search
depth - the maxumum search depth
progresive_time - the time limit for a progressive search
alpha_beta_cutoff - the a-priori alpht cutoff level
good_enough_cutoff - the a-priori good enough cutoff level
Method Detail

Abort_Search_In_Progress

public void Abort_Search_In_Progress(java.lang.String why)
remove the global side effects of a search in progress, but don't demolish the search driver, so we can look at it.

Parameters:
why - a reason why, in case anyone cares.

PercentDone

public double PercentDone()
return an estimate of percentage complete for the search. in a direct serach, this is only for entertainment, but with progressive searches, the estimate of done is used to decide if a new search should be started.

Returns:
0.0 to 1.0

Best_Search_Move

public commonMove Best_Search_Move()
return the move that is the result of the search, or null if the search was aborted.

Returns:
the best move from the search

Find_Static_Best_Move

public commonMove Find_Static_Best_Move(int randomn,
                                        double dif)
this is the main entry point to perform a search. From here, the search driver will call List_Of_Legal_Moves Make_Move Unmake_Move and Static_Evaluate_Position as needed, and will eventually produce an evaluated list of top level moves.

If "randomn" is not zero, then up to that number of moves are skipped unless the difference from the best move evaluation is more than dif

Parameters:
randomn - the number of potential moves to randomize
dif - the difference in evaluation from the best to stop randomizing
Returns:
a move selected as next
